text: The second tool is an outcome of a 2011 meeting of One Health experts in Bellagio, Italy, to assess the global progress of the adoption of the One Health approach (33) . This group of experts conducted a global inventory of 71 on-going One Health efforts and evaluated each programme against an assessment tool for achieving transformational change. While initially developed as an assessment instrument, the authors identified applicability as a change model tool for the transformation of One Health approaches to operationalized programmes.
